title: Shell to Withdraw From Russian Oil and Gas Amid Ukraine War
sub_head: Energy giant plans to halt all spot purchases of Russian crude and shut its gas stations, aviation-fuel and lubricant operations in the country
body:
Shell PLC said it is withdrawing from dealing in Russian oil and natural gas, saying it would immediately halt all spot purchase of crude from the country and will phase out its other trading and business dealings.
The energy giant previously said it would pull out of a number of joint ventures in the country. On Tuesday, it said it would also shut its service stations and aviation fuels and lubricants operations in Russia, and it wonâ€™t renew any Russian term contracts. It said it would find alternative supplies of oil as soon as possible, though it cautioned it could take weeks to fully make up the difference, leading to reduced production at some refineries.
